definitions.definition: A device for transmitting conversations and other sounds in real time across distances , now often a small portable unit also capable of running software etc.
examples: Daragh's on the phone at the moment. He'll call you when he's finished.
My phone ran out of battery.
There's an old-fashioned phone in the doctor's waiting room - it doesn't work anymore, of course.

definitions.definition: ( colloquial ) A person's telephone number (as a means of contact); digits .

main_definition: A device for transmitting conversations and other sounds in real time across distances , now often a small portable unit also capable of running software etc.
secondary_definitions: ( colloquial ) A person's telephone number (as a means of contact); digits .

definitions.definition: A speech segment that possesses distinct physical or perceptual properties, considered as a physical event without regard to its place in the phonology of a language.

main_definition: ( phonetics ) A speech segment that possesses distinct physical or perceptual properties, considered as a physical event without regard to its place in the phonology of a language.
